content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
 the problem involves a custom alphabet and encryption logic. It's a good example of string manipulation and understanding of modular arithmetic.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Tricky cipher puzzle, and it's quite fun.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A bit challenging to a beginner programmer but most intermediates should be able to solve this within the time constraints. I like the idea and it is quite creative, it is a nice variable Caesar cipher

Tricky puzzle! I would suggest making it slightly clearer:

- State that the encryption shifts letters to the right by the position value of the preceding letter.
- State that the alphabet string is 1-indexed (i.e. that "a" is in position 1, "b" is in position 2, etc.)
- For the wrap example, I would suggest explicitly defining the wrapping via "WXYZabc...", although I do understand why you included the preceding "a" in "aZ" and "aa".
- State in the goal section that the aim is to perform decryption.

Goal
* Suggest to format all the text within quotation marks as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

* Last example: I think you mean "aZ" instead of "az".

Input / Stub generator
* Please standardise the variable name (secret_message_cyphered vs secretmessage).

Output
* Goal section does not mention what the task of the clash is. Please at least add a description here in Output section to describe what [[secret_message_decyphered]] is in relation to [[secret_message_cyphered]]. More simply, you may just change the variable name to a description linked to [[secret_message_cyphered]].

Constraints
* Please mention that [[secret_message_cyphered]] contains only those characters in the alphabet mentioned in the statement.

Cases
* "Secret 1 - coma" (test): Please change "coma" to "comma".

* Please add one or more tests where the output contains the remaining characters not covered by other tests. Currently the characters already covered are:
(space),-.013:ABCDIMOPZabcdefghiklmnoprstuwy

* Please add one or more validators where the output contains the remaining characters not covered by other validators. Currently the characters already covered are:
(space),-.013:BCFMPZabcdefghiklmnoprstuvwy

Thanks.
Good remarks. Thanks. Hope it's all clear, now.
Thanks à lot EnderBox. Happy you liked it!
Thanks a lot ! Have a nice day!
Thanks ! Very proud to see my contribution fully approved!

Thanks. Just two more points:

Goal
* Last paragraph: Should be 67 instead of 63.

Output
* Please exclude "the decyphered" from the [[variable]] format.

I think it is all good now. 
Any other blocking point? 
Looking forward to the aproval!
